messages.text: Love hinders death. Love is life.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: If you want to be happy, be.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: If you look for perfection, you will never be content.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: The sole meaning of life is to serve humanity.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: To love is to live.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Freethinkers are those who are willing to use their minds without prejudice.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: We lost because we told ourselves we lost.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Boredom: the desire for desires.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Where love is, God is.
messages.author: Leo Tolstoy

messages.text: Man is a mystery.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: To go wrong in one's own way is better than to go right in someone else's.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The soul is healed by being with children.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The darker the night, the brighter the stars.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Beauty will save the world.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The man who lies to himself can never recognize truth.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: If God does not exist, then everything is permitted.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Taking a new step, uttering a new word, is what people fear most.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Man is sometimes extraordinarily, passionately, in love with suffering.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The degree of civilization in a society can be judged by entering its prisons.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: It is not the brains that matter most, but that which guides them, character, heart, generous qualities.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Love in action is a harsh and dreadful thing compared with love in dreams.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Nothing is easier than to denounce the evildoer; nothing is more difficult than to understand him.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: A man who has a conscience suffers whilst acknowledging his sin.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: If you want to overcome the whole world, overcome yourself.
messages.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

messages.text: Any idiot can face a crisis; it's this day-to-day living that wears you out.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: The role of the artist is to ask questions, not answer them.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: A man is what he believes.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Perhaps man has a hundred senses.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: If you have a story to tell, tell it, and stop.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: When a person doesn’t understand something, he searches outside of himself.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Without a knowledge of languages you feel as if you don’t have a passport.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: There is nothing more awful, insulting, and depressing than banality.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: In a man everything should be beautiful: face and clothes, soul and thoughts.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: If you want to work on your art, work on your life.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Love, friendship, respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: To regret the past, to hope in the future, and to never be satisfied with the present.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Medicine is my lawful wife, and literature is my mistress.
messages.author: Anton Chekhov

messages.text: Don't be sad, don't be angry, if life deceives you.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Submit to your grief; your time for joy will come.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Inspiration is needed in geometry, just as much as in poetry.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: A deception that elevates us is dearer than a host of low truths.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Habit is given us from above in place of happiness.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Love is the first sign of youth.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: And I have loved you, love still, perhaps.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: The less we love a woman, the easier it is for her to like us.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Blessed is he who was young in his youth.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: I have outlasted all desire.
messages.author: Aleksandr Pushkin

messages.text: Manuscripts don't burn.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Cowardice is the most terrible of vices.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Everything will turn out right, the world is built on that.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Never ask for anything. Never, and especially not from those who are stronger than you.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Follow me, reader, and I will show you such a love.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: People are like people. They love money, but that has always been so.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Yes, man is mortal, but that would be only half the trouble.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: The tongue can conceal the truth but the eyes never.
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: What would your good do if evil didn't exist?
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: Why try to pursue what is completed?
messages.author: Mikhail Bulgakov

messages.text: I stand as witness to the common lot, survivor of that time, that place.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: It is my torture and my utter gladness.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: I have learned how faces fall, how terror darts from under eyelids.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: You will hear thunder and remember me, and think: she wanted storms.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: I go forth to seek the lovely magic garden.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: Rising from the past, my shadow is running in silence to meet me.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: And my heart, as it was then, will be on fire.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: I have a lot of work to do today; I need to slaughter memory.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: Teach myself to live again.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: I am not able and don't want to miss this.
messages.author: Anna Akhmatova

messages.text: What is laid down, ordered, factual is never enough to embrace the whole truth.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: Life always spills over the rim of every cup.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: The whole of life is symbolic because the whole of it has meaning.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: I believe that cruelty and the powers of darkness will in time be crushed by the spirit of light.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: To be alive, to be alive, to be alive to the end.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: In all things, it is better to hope than to despair.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: It is not revolutions and upheavals that clear the road to new and better days, but someone’s soul inspired.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: When a great moment knocks on the door of your life, it is often no louder than the beating of your heart.
messages.author: Boris Pasternak

messages.text: There are books so alive you're afraid that while you weren't reading, the book has changed.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: Did anyone ever step twice into the same book?
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: A deception that elevates us is dearer than a host of low truths.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: Think about me lightly, think of me, and forget.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: My favorite mode of communication is in the world beyond: a dream.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: My second favorite is correspondence.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

messages.text: Your name is a finch in my hand.
messages.author: Marina Tsvetaeva
